Package se.arkalix.util.concurrent

Class Futures

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.util.concurrent.Futures
  • public final class Futures
extends java.lang.Object
    Various utilities for working will collections of Futures.

    • Method Detail

      • reduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> reduce​(Future<T>[] array,
                                           U identity,
                                           ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends U> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element in array in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value = identity;
     for (T element : array) {
         // Wait for element to become available.
         value = accumulator.apply(value, element);
     }
     return value; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the array elements are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        array - Array of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures in array completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

      • reduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> reduce​(java.util.stream.Stream<Future<T>> stream,
                                           U identity,
                                           ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends U> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element in stream in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value = identity;
     Iterator<T> iterator = stream.iterator();
     while (iterator.hasNext()) {
         T element = iterator.next();
         // Wait for element to become available.
         value = accumulator.apply(value, element);
     }
     return value; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the elements of the stream are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures in array completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

      • reduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> reduce​(java.lang.Iterable<Future<T>> iterable,
                                           U identity,
                                           ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends U> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element in iterable in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value = identity;
     Iterator<T> iterator = iterable.iterator();
     while (iterator.hasNext()) {
         T element = iterator.next();
         // Wait for element to become available.
         value = accumulator.apply(value, element);
     }
     return value; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the elements of the iterable are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        iterable - Iterable of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures in array completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

      • reduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> reduce​(java.util.Iterator<Future<T>> iterator,
                                           U identity,
                                           ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends U> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element in iterator in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value = identity;
     while (iterator.hasNext()) {
         T element = iterator.next();
         // Wait for element to become available.
         value = accumulator.apply(value, element);
     }
     return value; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the elements of the iterator are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        iterator - Iterator of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures in array completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

      • flatReduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> flatReduce​(Future<T>[] array,
                                               U identity,
                                               ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends Future<U>> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element in array in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value0 = identity;
     for (T element : array) {
         // Wait for element to become available.
         U value1 = accumulator.apply(value0, element);
         // Wait for value1 to become available.
         value0 = value1;
     }
     return value0; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the array elements are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        array - Array of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into another Future, which in turn completes with the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures in array completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

      • flatReduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> flatReduce​(java.util.stream.Stream<Future<T>> stream,
                                               U identity,
                                               ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends Future<U>> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element of stream in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value0 = identity;
     Iterator<T> iterator = stream.iterator();
     while (iterator.hasNext()) {
         T element = iterator.next();
         // Wait for element to become available.
         U value1 = accumulator.apply(value0, element);
         // Wait for value1 to become available.
         value0 = value1;
     }
     return value0; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the elements of the stream are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into another Future, which in turn completes with the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures of stream completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

      • flatReduce

        public static <T,​U> Future<U> flatReduce​(java.lang.Iterable<Future<T>> iterable,
                                               U identity,
                                               ThrowingBiFunction<? super U,​? super T,​? extends Future<U>> accumulator)
        Applies given accumulator to every element of iterable in a way that corresponds with the following code: 
             U value0 = identity;
     Iterator<T> iterator = iterable.iterator();
     while (iterator.hasNext()) {
         T element = iterator.next();
         // Wait for element to become available.
         U value1 = accumulator.apply(value0, element);
         // Wait for value1 to become available.
         value0 = value1;
     }
     return value0; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the elements of the iterable are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of value provided by futures in array if they complete successfully.
        U - Type of identity value and accumulated value.
        Parameters:
        iterable - Iterable of futures.
        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.
        accumulator - Function used to combine the last identity value with the successful result of a Future into another Future, which in turn completes with the next identity value.
        Returns:
        Future, completed with accumulated value only if all futures of iterable completes successfully. Otherwise it is failed with the first encountered error.

         value0 = value1;
     }
     return value0; // Accumulated value.

             U value0 = identity;
     for (T element : array) {
         U value1 = accumulator.apply(value0, element);
         // Wait for value1 to become available.
         value0 = value1;
     }
     return value0; // Accumulated value.
        In other words, the array elements are processed serially, from the first to the last. The waiting for each element to become available is performed in a non-blocking manner.

        Parameters:

        identity - Initial input to the accumulator function.

      • serialize

        public static <V> Future<java.util.List<V>> serialize​(Future<? extends V>[] array)
        Executes every future in array in sequence, collecting every successful result into a list. If any future fails, the returned future is failed with the same Throwable. If more than one future fails each subsequent failing future suppresses the exception of prior one.

        All futures in array are guaranteed to be executed, even if a future before another such in the given collection would fail.

        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of value futures completes with if successful.
        Parameters:
        array - Array of futures.
        Returns:
        Future completed with list of results from all provided futures, with the results being in the same order as the futures in the given array.

      • serialize

        public static <V> Future<java.util.List<V>> serialize​(java.util.stream.Stream<? extends Future<? extends V>> stream)
        Executes every future in stream in sequence, collecting every successful result into a list. If any future fails, the returned future is failed with the same Throwable. If more than one future fails each subsequent failing future suppresses the exception of prior one.

        All futures in stream are guaranteed to be executed, even if a future before another such in the given collection would fail.

        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of value futures completes with if successful.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream of futures.
        Returns:
        Future completed with list of results from all provided futures, with the results being in the same order as the futures in the given stream.

      • serialize

        public static <V> Future<java.util.List<V>> serialize​(java.lang.Iterable<? extends Future<? extends V>> iterable)
        Executes every future in iterable in sequence, collecting every successful result into a list. If any future fails, the returned future is failed with the same Throwable. If more than one future fails each subsequent failing future suppresses the exception of prior one.

        All futures in iterable are guaranteed to be executed, even if a future before another such in the given collection would fail.

        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of value futures completes with if successful.
        Parameters:
        iterable - Iterable of futures.
        Returns:
        Future completed with list of results from all provided futures, with the results being in the same order as the futures in the given iterable.

      • serialize

        public static <V> Future<java.util.List<V>> serialize​(java.util.Iterator<? extends Future<? extends V>> iterator)
        Executes every future in iterator in sequence, collecting every successful result into a list. If any future fails, the returned future is failed with the same Throwable. If more than one future fails each subsequent failing future suppresses the exception of the prior one.

        All futures in iterator are guaranteed to be executed, even if a future before another such in the given collection would fail.

        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of value futures completes with if successful.
        Parameters:
        iterator - Iterator of futures.
        Returns:
        Future completed with list of results from all provided futures, with the results being in the same order as the futures in the given iterator. Never fails.
